newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Shenzhen Expressway demand clogs trade.
newsitem.headline: Shenzhen Expressway demand clogs trade.

text.p: Strong demand for market debutant Shenzhen Expressway Co Ltd caused a back-up in trade executions in the stock in early trade on Wednesday, the Hong Kong Stock Exchange said.

"Trading did slow down a bit (on the stock) because of the heavy transactions but it did not jam up the system," a spokeswoman said, adding that the exchange had not received any complaints from its members.
"A rush of buy orders for the stock during the first 15 minutes of trade jammed up the stock page and delayed deals," said one sales manager at a regional brokerage.
"We placed buy orders as soon as trading began but we could only finish a deal when the stock hit HK$3.00," he said.
Shenzhen Expressway shares soared to a morning high of HK$3.375 after opening at HK$2.65.
They were issued at HK$2.20 each.
The stock stood at HK$2.775 in early afternoon trade.
